title: Four killed, three injured in tragic road accident near Sivapuram in Andhra Pradesh
content: The accident occurred around 9:30 am when a coconut-laden lorry heading from Markapuram to Vinukonda collided head-on with a Bolero Max vehicle in which the victims were travelling.

content: Delhi Traffic Police advisory warns of heavy congestion and diversions due to planned Tiranga Shaurya Samman Yatra near India Gate

title: Mundra port drug haul: SC dismisses bail plea of Delhi-based businessman

content: Conservation of Konkan‚Äôs lateritic plateau rock pools which are home to tadpoles and other organisms are important for the ecosystem maintenance, especially in the light of climate change, where erratic rain and temperature patterns are expected¬†

title: Maharashtra govt. holds meeting with defence forces
content: The meeting discussed improved intelligence sharing, greater use of technology, necessary precautionary measures, and the expected cooperation from the State government to defence forces

title: KMRL plans to introduce boat services in Edappally, Chilavannoor canals
content: Boat services will operate every 30 minutes along a newly navigable 11.5-km stretch from Muttar to Chitrapuzha via Edappally canal, with 10 new boats each with a vertical clearance of 3.5 metres, says the metro agency

title: Tatum carried off in Celtics' Game 4 loss; MRI next
content: Celtics star Jayson Tatum will have an MRI on Tuesday after suffering an apparent noncontact lower leg injury late in the fourth quarter of Boston's Game 4 loss to the Knicks on Monday night.

title: Curry (hamstring) doesn't expect to play Game 5
content: Warriors star Stephen Curry, who is rehabbing a Grade 1 left hamstring strain, does not expect to be available for Game 5 on Wednesday, he told Andscape's Marc J. Spears.

title: Mavericks win NBA draft lottery with 1.8% odds
content: The Dallas Mavericks won this year's NBA draft lottery, earning the right to land projected No. 1 pick Cooper Flagg.

title: Yanks' Cabrera taken off in ambulance after slide
content: Yankees third baseman Oswaldo Cabrera injured his left ankle when he reached back for the plate on an awkward slide Monday night in Seattle.

title: Brunson reminds Knicks 3-1 'nothing to celebrate'
content: As the Knicks took a commanding 3-1 series lead on the Celtics and moved to within a win of their first Eastern Conference finals appearance in 25 years, captain Jalen Brunson was quick to remind his teammates, "It's nothing to celebrate."

title: Sources: Kings expected to name Holland next GM
content: Ken Holland, who won four Stanley Cups as a Detroit Red Wings executive and helped lead the Edmonton Oilers to a runner-up finish last season, is expected to become general manager of the Los Angeles Kings, sources told ESPN Monday, confirming a report.

title: NCAA prez is open to Trump's idea of commission
content: NCAA president Charlie Baker said Monday he was "up for anything" when asked about the idea of a commission on collegiate athletics, an idea proposed by President Donald Trump.

title: Chiefs superfan gets 32 years for Okla. robbery
content: Chiefs superfan Xaviar Babudar was sentenced in an Oklahoma courtroom Monday to 32 years in prison, two and a half years after authorities caught him in the state as he fled from a local bank robbery.

content: We picked out players chosen on Days 2-3 of the 2025 draft who could contribute right away, including Saints QB Tyler Shough.

title: If anyone can bring the World Cup back to Brazil in 2026, it's Ancelotti
content: The worst-kept secret is out: Carlo Ancelotti is going to be the new Brazil manager. His task -- winning a first World Cup for the Selecao since 2002 -- isn't an easy one, but if anyone can do it, Ancelotti can.

title: Barcelona win fourth Cl√°sico and close on LaLiga, Chelsea lose top-four clash, more
content: Barcelona made it four wins in four games against rivals Real Madrid this season, taking a big step toward winning LaLiga in the process. Also, Chelsea's top-four hopes took a self-inflicted hit vs. Newcastle.

title: The VAR Review: Why Jackson was sent off for an elbow but Mings escaped
content: How did Aston Villa's Tyrone Mings escape a red card yet Chelsea striker Nicolas Jackson was sent off?

title: Brazil announce Ancelotti as new head coach
content: Carlo Ancelotti will be the first foreign coach of Brazil, the CBF announced on Monday. However, Real Madrid are yet to confirm his exit from the club.

title: Mascherano: Everything not 'fine' at Inter Miami
content: Inter Miami CF coach Javier Mascherano has stated that "there are things that need to be corrected" following a poor run of form and 4-1 defeat to Minnesota United on Saturday.

title: Sources: Alonso close to being named Madrid boss
content: Real Madrid are finalising a deal for Xabi Alonso to become their new coach as soon as possible, multiple sources have told ESPN, with the club keen to have him in place for this summer's Club World Cup.

title: Bundesliga champ Kane: What will they say now?
content: Harry Kane has brushed off the criticism he has received during his wait for his first career trophy, saying "we'll see what people talk about now."

title: Wrexham to play July friendlies in Australia, NZ
content: Wrexham AFC will play three A-League clubs as part of a preseason friendly tour across Australia and New Zealand in July.

title: 15,000 'violent' Argentine fans banned from CWC
content: Argentine Security Minister Patricia Bullrich handed the United States Embassy in Buenos Aires on Monday a list of 15,000 violent soccer fans who will be banned from stadiums during the upcoming Club World Cup.

title: France aims to copy Premier League finance model
content: French football intends to have its own version of the Premier League, with a club-owned entity replacing the Ligue de Football Professionnel (LFP) as part of plans announced by French Football Federation president Philippe Diallo on Monday.

content: UFC 315 wasn't the biggest card of the year on paper, but the fights were entertaining minus one blemish.

content: After rocking Miami 4-1, Minnesota is closing in on the Herons in the top 10 of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

content: Manchester United have moved ahead of Chelsea in the race to sign Liam Delap. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna Retires With A Message Mentioning His Successor
content: Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna bid farewell to his colleagues at the Supreme Court this morning as he passed on the baton to Justice BR Gavai.

title: Op Herof: Baloch Rebels Claim Responsibility For 71 Attacks On Pak Forces
content: The Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) has claimed responsibility for 71 "coordinated attacks" at more than 51 locations across Pakistan's Balochistan province under its ongoing 'Operation Herof'.

title: Fentanyl Is A US Issue, Says China, Calls Punitive Tariffs Unreasonable
content: The responsibility of tackling the fentanyl issue in the United States lies within the US itself, China's foreign ministry said on Tuesday, rejecting the punitive tariffs Washington imposed on Beijing for not stemming the inflow.

title: "Told To Use More Baby Oil": Escort Testifies In Sean 'Diddy' Combs Sex Trafficking Case
content: The escort detailed multiple graphic encounters with Sean 'Diddy' Combs and singer Cassie Ventura, as part of the music mogul's ongoing trial for sex trafficking and racketeering charges.

title: Kim Kardashian To Testify In Paris Multi-Million-Dollar Robbery Trial
content: A-list celebrity Kim Kardashian is to testify in a Paris court on Tuesday, an eagerly awaited appearance nearly a decade after masked men robbed her at gunpoint of millions of dollars of jewellery during the French capital's fashion week.

title: Chan Chan, UNESCO World Heritage Site In Peru, Defaced With Obscene Graffiti
content: A vandal defaced Chan Chan, a UNESCO World Heritage Site in northern Peru, with obscene graffiti over the weekend, the Ministry of Culture said Monday.

title: 3 Terrorists Killed In Encounter In Jammu And Kashmir's Shopian
content: Three terrorists have been killed in an encounter with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian.

title: "Stupid" To Reject Free Air Force One As Gift By Qatar: Trump Dismisses Criticism
content: US President Donald Trump's plans to receive a free Air Force One replacement from Qatar has triggered a massive political row and raised various concerns, even as he said he would be "stupid" not to accept such a gift.

title: Life Sentence For 9 Convicts In Tamil Nadu's 2019 Pollachi Sex Assault Case
content: Six years after nine men were accused of sexually assaulting and blackmailing several women in Tamil Nadu'sPollachi, a court has pronounced them guilty. Sessions court Judge R Nandhini Devi found the men guilty of gangrape and repeated rape.

title: The Airline Hack One Entrepreneur Uses To Never Miss A Connection
content: At Bloomberg Pursuits, we love to travel. And we always want to make sure we're doing it right. So we're talking to road warriors to learn about their high-end hacks, tips, and off-the-wall experiences. These are the Distinguished Travel Hackers .

title: "100 Times Brighter": NASA's Webb Telescope Captures New Details Of Auroras On Jupiter
content: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) has captured stunning images of dancing lights, called auroras, on Jupiter. Similar to the Northern Lights we see on Earth.

title: Russia Downed Malaysian Airline MH17 In Ukraine, Rules UN Aviation Body
content: The UN aviation council on Monday ruled that Russia was responsible for the downing of a Malaysian airliner over Ukraine in 2014 with the deaths of 298 passengers and crew, the Dutch government said.

title: Hamas Releases Last Living American Held Hostage In Gaza
content: Hamas freed the last living American citizen held hostage in Gaza, following talks between the US and the group ahead of a Middle East visit by President Donald Trump.

title: Bangladesh Bans Sheikh Hasina's Awami League, Suspends Party Registration

title: At 17, Sextortion Drove Him To Suicide. Police Finally His Blackmailers
content: At least four people have been arrested in Cote d'Ivoire for their alleged roles in a global sextortion and money laundering scam, which forced a 17-year-old boy to die by suicide in Northern California in 2022.

title: Anthony Albanese Sworn In As PM, Australia's Labor Government Gets Second Term

content: the second round of the 2025 playoffs is here . the no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers kicked off the East semis by taking a 2-0 lead over the No. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers . lopsided game 4 win gave the team a 3-1 series lead in the series .

content: Karnataka Today Your daily dose of news highlights from the world of cinema and streaming . today's Cache Your download of the top 5 technology stories of the day . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science .

title: College baseball Week 13: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: the LSU Tigers are back at No. 1 after the way they played on the road against the Arkansas Razorbacks . last week's top team the Texas Longhorns dropped a couple spots after losing its series to the Florida Gators . the Gators have managed to climb back in the top 25 at no. 23 .

title: Kamal commends Centre for response to Pahalgam terror attack
content: Karnataka Today Your daily dose of news highlights from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in! health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The Hindu On Books Books of the week .

title: Two members of TGERC take oath
content: Karnataka Today Your daily dose of news highlights from the world of cinema and streaming . today's Cache Your download of the top 5 technology stories of the day . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science .

title: Multiple divisions in flux after welterweight, women's flyweight title fights
content: Jack Della Maddalena stuns Belal Muhammad in the main event of the welterweight championship at UFC 315 . Valentina Shevchenko began her second career title defense and once again proved she is one of the greatest MMA fighters ever . Makhachev is the no. 1 pound-for-pound fighter in 2025 .

title: Madrid crisis deepens as Vini Jr. injury confirmed
content: Carlo Ancelotti will leave real madrid at the end of the season to take charge of the brazilian national team . ancelotti has been diagnosed with a sprain in his left ankle, the club said . he will take charge from may 26 when the laLiga season concludes .

title: Operation Keller: 3 LeT terrorists killed during encounter with Army in J&K's Shopian
content: Indian armed forces neutralized three Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists in Shopian's Keller area, Jammu and Kashmir, following a search operation prompted by specific intelligence. This action follows India's declaration that future terror acts will be treated as acts of war, signaling a tougher stance against Pakistan-based groups.

title: PM Modi poses in front of S-400 missile system, sends message to Pakistan
content: Prime Minister Modi refuted Pakistan's claim of destroying India's S-400 air defense system by visiting the Adampur airbase and posing with the system. This follows Pakistan's disinformation campaign, including false videos, after India's Operation Sindoor. The Ministry of External Affairs exposed Pakistan's false claims about damaging the S-400 and BrahMos missile base.

title: Explained: How India's punitive steps will continue to hit Pakistan
content: Despite the India-Pakistan ceasefire, India's economic measures against Pakistan remain in effect. These actions, initiated after the Pahalgam attack, include the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, impacting Pakistan's water resources and agriculture. A complete ban on direct and indirect trade further cripples Pakistan's economy by blocking $500 million in goods.

title: Pakistani hackers attacked 1.5M+ Indian sites after Operation Sindoor
content: Following the Pahalgam terror strike, Maharashtra Cyber identified seven APT groups, primarily Pakistan-allied, responsible for over 1.5 million cyber attacks targeting critical Indian infrastructure. While only 150 attacks succeeded, these groups employed malware, DDoS attacks, and misinformation campaigns. The attacks originated from Pakistan, Bangladesh, the Middle East, and Indonesia, with some successful defacements and alleged data theft.

title: Tendulkar and Kohli gave India 33 years of stability at No. 4. Who next?
content: With Virat Kohli retiring from Test cricket ahead of the five-match Test series in England, the big question for Gautam Gambhir and Ajit Agarkar will be who bats at No. 4 for India in Test cricket. The position for the past three decades has been owned by Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli. Now, with Virat's announcement, India will have to look for options. Timesofindia.com spoke to several experts on figuring out who can be India's next mainstay.

title: Viral video: Virat Kohli speaks for the first time since Test retirement
content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma visited Vrindavan Dham after Kohli's Test retirement. They sought blessings from Swami Premanand Maharaj. A video shows Kohli expressing peace with his decision. Kohli's retirement marks the end of a significant Test career. He leaves behind a legacy of runs and leadership. His influence will continue to shape Indian cricket.

title: IndiGo, Air India cancel flights to these airports - check list
content: Amidst tensions between India and Pakistan, airlines like Air India and IndiGo cancelled flights to several northern destinations on May 13th after briefly resuming services. The shutdown of 32 airports had earlier severely affected flight services, resulting in more than 300 daily flight cancellations.

title: US-China trade: Trump says he called Apple CEO after China tariff rollback and ...
content: Following a US-China trade agreement where tariffs are suspended for 90 days, President Trump claimed Apple CEO Tim Cook plans to increase US investments, potentially building more plants. This news follows reports of Apple considering iPhone price hikes, possibly linked to tariffs.

title: Virat Kohli: The dressing room DJ who nailed Ishant Sharma's mimicry
content: Virat Kohli's sudden retirement from Test cricket has sent ripples through the cricketing world. Among those is his former India and Delhi teammate, Shikhar Dhawan. In an exclusive interview, Dhawan fondly recalls not just Kohli's on-field heroics but also his vibrant presence in the dressing room. From celebrating Dhawan's debut century with infectious energy to his playful mimicry of teammates like Ishant Sharma, Dhawan paints a picture of Kohli's multifaceted personality.

title: Posters of Pahalgam attack suspects surface; Rs 20 lakh bounty announced
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack on April 22, which killed 26 people, Jammu and Kashmir Police released photographs of three suspects, offering a ‚Çπ20 lakh reward for information. The TRF claimed responsibility, leading to India's Operation Sindoor targeting terrorist installations in Pakistan.

title: Infosys employees get a heads up on lower bonus payouts
content: Infosys has announced lower-than-expected performance bonus payouts for Q4 FY25, citing ongoing uncertainties in the software services sector. HR executives assured employees that this downturn is temporary and top performers will be compensated in the next growth cycle. This decision follows a reported 11.7% drop in net profit and cautious revenue guidance.

title: Exclusive: 'There's only one Tendulkar and there's only one Kohli'
content: In an exclusive interview with Timesofindia.com, former South Africa cricketer Mark Boucher goes down memory lane and recollects the time he shared the dressing room with a young Virat Kohli during his three-year stint with the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) from 2008-10. The former gloveman revealed how he helped Kohli hone his technique against short-pitched bowling and explained why his eagerness to learn and aggressive mindset laid the foundation for his stellar career.

title: CBSE Class 10 result declared at cbse.gov.in with 93.66% pass rate
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has declared the Class 10th Results for 2025, with a national pass percentage of 93.66%. The Prayagraj region saw a decline, with a pass percentage of 91.01%, dropping to 15th place. Students can check their results on official CBSE websites or access digital marksheets through DigiLocker, UMANG app, and SMS-based services.

title: Ferozepur woman injured in Pakistani drone attack dies; first civilian casualty in Punjab
content: Sukhwinder Kaur, 50, has died from injuries sustained in a drone attack in Khai Pheme Ke village, Ferozepur. She succumbed to her injuries at DMC hospital. Her husband, Lakhwinder Singh, is currently admitted at DMC, while their son, Monu, is receiving treatment at a private hospital in Ferozepur. The family sustained injuries in the drone attack, prompting medical intervention.

title: Infosys employees brace for lower bonus payouts; here‚Äôs why
content: Infosys employees face reduced performance bonuses for the quarter ending March 2025 due to decreased profits, amidst industry uncertainty. While salary revisions occurred in February, net profits declined by 11.7%

title: Kohli visits Vrindavan with Anushka Sharma just day after test retirement
content: Following his surprising Test retirement announcement, Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma were seen in Vrindavan, seeking a peaceful break. They visited their spiritual guide, Premanand Maharaj, after Kohli's major decision to step away from Test cricket. Anushka shared a heartfelt tribute, celebrating his strength and evolution, hinting at travel plans for the couple's future.

title: Border tension spurs Hyderabad missile firms to fast-track supplies
content: Following Operation Sindoor, the Indian government is expediting missile production. Manufacturers in Hyderabad are working to quickly deliver critical systems for missiles like BrahMos and Akash. The Defence Ministry is also engaging with drone and anti-drone tech companies to enhance capabilities. Commanders have procurement rights to address vulnerabilities, especially aerial threats.

title: 'Virat ko chhod do, dusre bhai ko padha likha lo': The making of Kohli
content: Atul Wassan recalls a young Virat Kohli's early days, recognizing his special talent at age 12. Wassan nurtured Kohli, selecting him for Ranji Trophy. Kohli's impact on cricket is undeniable, similar to legends like Hayden and Gilchrist. After retiring from Test cricket, Kohli aims to enjoy life, focusing on IPL and potentially the Olympics, prioritizing family and personal fulfillment.

title: India-Pak tensions: Tharoor lists 4 reasons why Trump‚Äôs remarks are 'disappointing'
content: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has strongly criticized Donald Trump's remarks on India-Pakistan tensions, deeming them 'deeply disappointing.' Tharoor argues Trump's stance risks reversing diplomatic progress by equating victim and perpetrator, offering Pakistan an unearned negotiating framework, internationalizing the Kashmir issue, and re-hyphenating India and Pakistan.

title: Man arrested after fire at UK PM Keir Starmer‚Äôs home in London
content: A 21-year-old man has been arrested in London. He is suspected of arson. The fire occurred at a property linked to British Prime Minister Keir Starmer. The incident took place early Monday. The London Fire Brigade responded promptly. The fire caused damage to the entrance. Investigations are ongoing. Starmer's spokesperson thanked the emergency services. Further comments will be provided later.

title: Official vs unofficial websites to check CBSE class 10, 12 results
content: As CBSE prepares to declare the 2025 Class 10 and 12 results, students are advised to use only official platforms like cbse.gov.in, results.cbse.nic.in, DigiLocker, UMANG, SMS, and IVRS. The article outlines how to access results securely, highlights risks of unofficial portals, and provides step-by-step instructions for safe result checking. It also explains CBSE‚Äôs digital infrastructure and stresses the importance of avoiding fake sites during high-traffic periods.

title: CA gives major update on players unwilling to return to India for IPL
content: The Indian Premier League is set to resume on May 17. Cricket Australia is backing players who opt out due to safety concerns. The World Test Championship final is approaching soon. Several key Australian players are involved. Coaches and commentators are also considering their return. The IPL's resumption will be closely monitored for both cricket and player safety.

title: 'Bullying & tyranny will only isolate oneself': Xi after US-China reach trade deal
content: In a veiled critique of the United States, Chinese President Xi Jinping condemned bullying and trade wars, emphasizing collaboration for global stability. This statement followed a US-China agreement to lower tariffs after a period of escalating duties. The US will reduce tariffs on Chinese imports to 30%, while China will lower duties to 10%.

title: Meet the IAF personnel who played a key role in Operation Sindoor
content: India's robust air defence system successfully thwarted numerous missile and drone attacks launched by Pakistan, ensuring the nation's security. Operation Sindoor highlighted the crucial role of the Integrated Air Command and Control System. PM Modi acknowledged the air defence system's effectiveness in intercepting and destroying Pakistani threats aimed at civilian targets, exposing Pakistan's actions to the world.

title: Operation Sindoor: Turkish drones to Chinese missiles, India beat them all
content: India's integrated air defense network successfully thwarted Pakistani aerial attacks, including Turkish drones and Chinese missiles, during recent hostilities. Military officials showcased evidence of Pakistan's use of advanced weaponry, most of which were intercepted. The robust AD system, incorporating indigenous weapons like Akash, ensured the safety of Indian airspace and military installations.

title: ‚ÄòYou should be embarrassed‚Äô: Trump snaps at reporter over Qatari jet question
content: Donald Trump defended the potential acquisition of a $400 million jet from Qatar for the Department of Defense, dismissing concerns about it being a personal gift. He rebuked a reporter questioning the deal, likening it to accepting a 'gimme' in golf.

title: 'Dance of the Hillary': Guard your data, cops warn of Pak virus onslaught
content: Indian intelligence agencies have discovered a Pakistan-linked cyber-attack campaign, distributing malware named 'Dance of the Hillary' through social media platforms like WhatsApp and Facebook. This malware, spread via video or document files, steals sensitive user data and enables remote device control. Punjab Police issued a cyber alert, urging vigilance against suspicious links to protect personal and national security.

title: At least 14 dead after consuming spurious liquor in Amritsar
content: Tragedy struck Amritsar as at least 17 people died and several others were hospitalized after consuming spurious liquor in villages under the Majitha block. Authorities have launched a probe, detaining five individuals and registering two FIRs. Raids are underway to apprehend more manufacturers, with officials providing assistance to affected families and working to prevent further casualties.

title: Gold prices dip Rs 6,500 per 10 gm; MCX gold June futures at around Rs 92,975/10 gm
content: Gold prices on MCX have plummeted to Rs 92,975/10 grams, a significant drop from its recent peak, due to easing geopolitical tensions and a strengthened dollar. Silver, however, showed resilience, trading higher at Rs 96,287/kg.

title: Barca push the knife further into Madrid, inch closer to 28th La Liga title
content: Barcelona beat Real Madrid 4-3 on Sunday and went seven points clear at the top of La Liga and within touching distance of a 28th league title. They're now on the verge of doing a domestic double. Or treble if you also include the Spanish Super Cup.

title: Arnold Schwarzenegger's son opens up on weight loss journey
content: Christopher Schwarzenegger, Arnold's son, revealed his weight loss journey. He spoke about his struggles since high school. He mentioned insecurities about his weight. He cut out bread during Lent. He lost 30 pounds in two months. He still feels he has more to go. He shared this at an event in Los Angeles. Others like Kelly Osbourne and Jeff Beacher were also present.

title: Feeling the heat? It might be aging you faster than you think
content: A recent study reveals that extreme heat accelerates biological aging, particularly in older adults. Researchers found a correlation between living in areas with more days of extreme heat and increased biological age, comparable to the effects of smoking. Staying hydrated, seeking cooler environments, and checking on vulnerable individuals are crucial for mitigating the health hazards of heatwaves.

title: Nifty50 tanks below 24,700; BSE Sensex dips over 700 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Tuesday a day after an over 3.5% rally. While Nifty50 went below 24,600, BSE Sensex was below 81,200.

title: ‚ÄòInfluenced by tantrik‚Äô, woman throws 2-year-old ‚Äòpossessed‚Äô son into canal
content: In a incident, a 35-year-old woman, allegedly under the influence of an occult practitioner, has been arrested for throwing her two-year-old son into a canal in Faridabad. Authorities are currently searching for the child's body. The woman's husband revealed she believed their son was possessed, influenced by the occultist's claims, leading to this tragic event.

title: Air India cancels flight operations at 8 locations; issues advisory
content: Air India and Indigo have announced the cancellation of flight operations to and from several locations, including Jammu, Leh, Jodhpur, Amritsar, and Chandigarh, for today, May 13th. This decision was made in light of recent developments and with passenger safety as the top priority. Air India is closely monitoring the situation and will provide updates as they become available.

title: Operation Sindoor: Armed forces used wide range of space assets, both Indian and foreign
content: During Operation Sindoor, Indian armed forces utilized a range of domestic and international space assets, including Cartosat and Risat satellites, alongside commercial data from Maxar. ISRO facilitated repeatable data and plans to launch EOS-09 or Risat-1B on May 18, enhancing surveillance with all-weather, high-resolution imagery.

title: Kohli's Ranji coach drops bombshell: 'He was preparing for England Tests'
content: Virat Kohli's recent Test retirement shocked the cricketing world, including his former coach Sarandeep Singh, who revealed Kohli was actively preparing for the upcoming England series and showed no prior indications of stepping down. Singh mentioned Kohli's eagerness to replicate his 2018 success in England, making his sudden exit unexpected, especially with the crucial Test series against England approaching.

title: Virat Kohli memes break internet as fans speculate on his ODI retirement
content: Virat Kohli's sudden Test retirement has sparked a frenzy of reactions online, with fans sharing tributes and speculations about his ODI future. Having already retired from T20s, it's widely assumed the 2027 Cricket World Cup could be his last appearance. His coach, Rajkumar Sharma, lauded Kohli's Test career and hopes for ODI success.

title: Virat Kohli announces test retirement; Avneet Kaur cheers him on
content: Avneet Kaur's recent public support for Virat Kohli has sparked renewed interest online. Following Kohli's Test cricket retirement announcement, Avneet was seen enthusiastically cheering for him alongside Munawar Faruqui and Shehnaaz Gill. This comes after a brief social media stir caused by Kohli's accidental 'like' on one of Avneet's pictures, which he later clarified.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock market recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta recommends buying CDSL and Indian Bank. CDSL, with a buy range of Rs 1290-1270, targets Rs 1378, having broken a downward trend. Indian Bank, buy range Rs 570-580, aims for Rs 615, supported by its 40-day moving average.

title: 'He'll be there to ... ': Kohli's childhood coach's 2027 ODI WC prediction
content: Rajkumar Sharma, Virat Kohli's childhood coach, lauded Kohli's remarkable Test career following his unexpected retirement. Sharma expressed pride in Kohli's contributions and voiced optimism for his continued commitment to ODI cricket. He hopes Kohli will lead India to victory in the 2027 ICC ODI World Cup, anticipating another glorious chapter in his career.

title: Trump cites 'racial discrimination' as first batch of white SA refugees land in US
content: In a controversial move, the Trump administration granted refugee status to 49 white South Africans, mostly Afrikaners, citing racial persecution. Welcomed by US officials, President Trump defended the decision, alleging a "genocide" against white farmers, a claim South Africa vehemently denies. Critics highlight the contradiction with Trump's restrictive immigration policies, while allies like Elon Musk support his concerns.

title: Karnataka Student, 12, Stabs To Death Senior Over Rs 5 Snack
content: a class 8 student died after being stabbed by a junior during an argument . the incident occurred near their home in hubballi, karnataka . a juvenile has been taken into custody and is accused of killing his school senior .
